rev.comment: /* 2001: A Space Odyssey */ unncessary fair use; apes image might be useful, but not the entire montage
rev.diff:
Line 93: Line 93:
===''2001: A Space Odyssey''===
===''2001: A Space Odyssey''===
{{Main|2001: A Space Odyssey (film)}}
{{Main|2001: A Space Odyssey (film)}}
â
[[Image:2001Montage.JPG|thumb|right|350px|Three iconic shots from 2001:A Space Odyssey. The sun-earth-moon conjunction of the opening, the monolith when encountered by apes, and the PanAm space plane.]]
 
Kubrick spent five years developing his next film, ''[[2001: A Space Odyssey (film)|2001: A Space Odyssey]]'' (1968). The film was conceived as a [[Cinerama]] spectacle and was photographed in [[Super Panavision 70]]. Kubrick co-wrote the screenplay with science fiction writer Sir [[Arthur C. Clarke]], expanding on Clarke's short story "[[The Sentinel (short story)|The Sentinel]]". Kubrick reportedly told Clarke that his intention was to make "the proverbial great science-fiction film."
Kubrick spent five years developing his next film, ''[[2001: A Space Odyssey (film)|2001: A Space Odyssey]]'' (1968). The film was conceived as a [[Cinerama]] spectacle and was photographed in [[Super Panavision 70]]. Kubrick co-wrote the screenplay with science fiction writer Sir [[Arthur C. Clarke]], expanding on Clarke's short story "[[The Sentinel (short story)|The Sentinel]]". Kubrick reportedly told Clarke that his intention was to make "the proverbial great science-fiction film."
